title: WACCU disburses Gh 4,050,170.00 as loans
text:
30 September 2015 23:00 CET WACCU disburses GhÈ¼ 4,050,170.00 as loans By GNA 
Wa, Sept 30, GNA - The Wa Community Co-operative Credit Union (WACCU), has disbursed a total of GhÈ¼ 4,050,170.00 as loans to its members within the year 2015. 
The loans were disbursed to 517 members made up of 292 males who received GhÈ¼ 2,176,330.00, 212 females given GhÈ¼ 1,013,540.00 and GhÈ¼ 860, 300. 00 Ghana cedi provided to 67 organisations. 
Mr. Paul N. Seidu, Chairman of the Loans Committee of the WACCU made this known when he presented the financial report of the organisation at its annual general meeting in Wa. 
He said a total cumulative number of 728 loans were outstanding giving a total cumulative amount of GhÈ¼ 5,453,690.09 outstanding with 227 males GhÈ¼ 2,548,951.24, 392 females GhÈ¼ 811,183.10 and 109 organisations GhÈ¼ 2,093,555.75. 
Mr. Seidu however said a total amount of GhÈ¼ 4,500,449.06 was received as loan repayment which gave the WACCU GhÈ¼ 1,140,400.34 as interest on loans. 
On delinquent loans, the Loan's Chairman said 73 males owed the organisation with GhÈ¼ 104,393.62, 46 females indebted with GhÈ¼ 65,608.64 and 11 organisations, GhÈ¼ 11,141.65, bringing the total amount owed the organisation to 181,143.91 Ghana cedi. 
Mr. Seidu said some members refuse to listen to financial counseling, poor loan repayment pattern of some loaners, emergence and fall of mushroom financial organisations, and low savings balances of some loaners as some of the challenges hindering repayment of loans. 
Mr. Moses N. Donneyong, WACCU Board Chairman, said the Union saw good growth in its membership of 13,779, representing growth rate of six percent from 13,028 last year. 
Seventy-four per cent of the members had the total of their shares and savings being at least GhÈ¼ 55.00 while minimum share had been increased from GhÈ¼ 50.00 to GhÈ¼ 100.00. 
Mr. Donneyong said the total share value of WACCU grew by less than one per cent during the year from GhÈ¼ 645,000.00 in June 2014 to GhÈ¼ 650,000.00at June 2015. 
He said savings increased from GhÈ¼ 6,600,000.00 in fiscal year 2014 to just GhÈ¼ 7,100,000.00, representing eight per cent growth over the previous year. 
He said the Union failed to stay within Credit Union Association standard of 80 percent of assets as savings and urged members to consider the Union as their own and a dependable partner. 
GNA
